intro: Molucca spinosa, commonly known as the Moluccan spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Molucca spinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
